next.name: add
tip:
U: add <bucket> [<repo>]
Add Scoop bucket
E: add extras
   add abgo_bucket https://github.com/abgox/abgo_bucket.git

next.name: rm
tip:
U: rm <bucket>
Remove Scoop bucket
E: rm extras
   rm abgo_bucket

next.name: known
tip:
List all official known buckets
You can add them without the repo remote address
E: scoop bucket add extras

root.name: search
tip:
U: search <query>
Search installable applications
E: search sudo        --- Search sudo in each bucket (order follows scoop bucket list)
   search main/sudo   --- Search sudo only in main

root.name: install
tip:
U: install [options] <app>
Install application
E: install sudo           --- Search sudo in each bucket and install if found
   install main/sudo      --- Search sudo only in main and install if found
   install -u main/sudo   --- Install application without updating Scoop

root.name: uninstall
tip:
U: uninstall [options] <app>
Uninstall application
E: uninstall sudo

options.name: -p
tip: Remove persistent data under the persist directory

root.name: update
tip:
U: update [options] [<app>]
Update application or Scoop itself
E: update        --- Update Scoop itself
   update 7zip   --- Update 7zip

options.name: -f
tip: Force update even if no new versions

root.name: list
tip:
U: list [query]
List installed applications
E: list      --- List all installed applications
   list i    --- List applications with names containing 'i'
   list ^i   --- List applications starting with 'i'
   list i$   --- List applications ending with 'i'

root.name: info
tip:
U: info [--verbose] <app>
Display information about a specific application
E: info 7zip

root.name: cache
tip:
U: cache show|rm [<app>] [<app>...]
Manage download cache
E: cache                --- Show all download caches
   cache show 7zip      --- Show 7zip download cache
   cache rm 7zip sudo   --- Remove 7zip sudo download cache

next.name: rm
tip:
Remove download cache for specified applications
E: rm *     --- Remove all download caches
   rm 7zip  --- Remove 7zip download cache

root.name: reset
tip:
U: reset <app|*>
Reset applications to resolve conflicts
E: reset python
   reset python27

root.name: cleanup
tip:
U: cleanup [options] <app|*>
Clean up applications (Remove old versions)
E: cleanup 7zip

root.name: prefix
tip:
U: prefix <app>
Return the path for a specified application
E: prefix 7zip

root.name: cat
tip:
U: cat <app>
Display the content of a specified application's manifest
E: cat 7zip

root.name: checkup
root.tip: Check if Scoop has potential issues

next.name: add
tip:
U: add <alias> <command> <description>
Add command aliases
E: add upgrade 'scoop update *' 'Updates all apps'
   Type 'scoop upgrade' to run 'scoop update *'

next.name: rm
tip:
U: rm <alias>
Remove command aliases
E: rm upgrade

next.name: list
tip: List all shims or matching shims

next.name: rm
tip:
U: rm <shim> [<shim>...]
Remove shims
(This may remove shims added by application manifests, be cautious)

next.name: alter
tip: Replace the target source of a shim

root.name: config
tip:
U: config [rm] name [value]
Manage Scoop configuration
E: config                  --- Get all configurations
   config <name>           --- Get configuration
   config <name> <value>   --- Set configuration
   config rm <name>        --- Remove configuration

root.name: which
tip:
U: which <command>
Locate a shim/executable (similar to the 'which' command on Linux)
E: which scoop

root.name: hold
tip:
U: hold [-g] <app>
Disable updates for a specified app
E: hold 7zip

options.name: -g
tip: Disable updates for a specified app globally

root.name: unhold
tip:
U: unhold [-g] <app>
Enable updates for a specified app
E: unhold 7zip

options.name: -g
tip: Enable updates for a specified app globally

root.name: export
tip:
U: export [-c] > scoop_file.json
Export installed apps, buckets (and optional config) in JSON format
E: export -c > ~/Desktop/scoop_file.json   --- Export to scoop_file.json under the Desktop directory

options.name: -c
tip: Include Scoop's configuration in the export

root.name: import
tip:
U: import <path|url>
Import installed apps, buckets (and config) from a specified file in JSON format
E: import ~/Desktop/scoop_file.json

root.name: depends
tip:
U: depends <app>
List dependencies for an app, ordered by installation sequence
E: depends python

root.name: status
tip:
U: status [-l|--local]
Display status and check for new app versions
E: status

options.name: -l
tip: Check the status of locally installed apps only and disable remote fetching/checking of Scoop and buckets

root.name: download
tip:
U: download [options] <app>
Download apps in the cache folder and verify hashes
E: download git                     --- Download an app without installing it
   download gh@2.7.0                --- Download a different version of an app
   download https://xxx/sudo.json   --- Download an app from a manifest via URL
   download path/to/app.json        --- Download an app from a local manifest on the computer

options.name: -u
tip: Only download without updating Scoop if there's an update available

options.name: -f
tip: Force the download and overwrite the download cache

root.name: virustotal
tip: Look up the hash or URL of an app on virustotal.com

options.name: -u
tip: Only check without updating Scoop if there's an update available

options.name: -s
tip:
U: -s|--scan
Submit download URLs for analysis (and future retrieval) for packages without VirusTotal information
This requires configuring virustotal_api_key

options.name: -n
tip: By default, it also checks all dependencies. This option bypasses it

root.name: home
tip:
U: home <app>
Open the homepage of an app
E: home sudo

options.name: -v
tip: Show Scoop version and the latest commit information of the buckets

config.name: disable_hooks
tip:
Current Value: <@Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.config.comp_config.scoop.disable_hooks}}<@Blue>
Set whether to disable hooks. Default to 0.
The hooks will get the name of the installed apps, cache, etc. and add them in completions dynamically.
(e.g. <@Magenta>uninstall<@Blue>, <@Magenta>update<@Blue>, <@Magenta>bucket<@Blue>, <@Magenta>cache rm<@Blue>, <@Magenta>hold<@Blue>...)
For example, enter <@Magenta>scoop uninstall<@Blue>, press <@Magenta>Space<@Blue> and <@Magenta>Tab<@Blue> key,
and you can get some extra completions about the name of the installed apps.
You can disable hooks by running <@Magenta>psc completion scoop disable_hooks 1<@Blue>.
